metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15680 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
TightVNC code version 1.3.10 contains null pointer dereference in HandleZlibBPP function, which results Denial of System (DoS). This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity. Pavel Cheremushkin discovered that TightVNC has a null pointer dereference vulnerability. An attacker could use it to cause a Denial of Service or possible a remote code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-15680` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.13+dfsg-1
libvncserver1 - 0.9.13+dfsg-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per upstream, this is a non-issue in libvncserver as checks are already done in zlib, see: https://github.com/LibVNC/libvncserver/issues/359#issuecomment-599133529 for completeness, the fix was added to focal and earlier releases, but will not be added to groovy+

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.13+dfsg-1').
